sen.j: 小田海僊（おだ かいせん、天明5年（1785年） - 文久2年閏8月24日 (旧暦)（1862年10月17日））は、江戸時代後期の日本の南画。
sen.e: Kaisen ODA (1785 - October 17, 1862) was a Japanese Nanga painter (a school of painting originating in China) in the late Edo period.
Kaisen ODA (1785 - October 17, 1862) was a Japanese painter of nanga (a school of painting originating in China) who lived during the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 江戸時代後期の→who lived during the late Edo period（"who lived during"の表現に変更しました。）南画についての説明の英訳が付されているので、南画の画家に変更しました。
sen.e: Kaisen ODA (1785 - October 17, 1862) was a Japanese painter of nanga (a school of painting originating in China) who lived during the late Edo period.

sen.j: 通称 良平、名は羸（るい）、または瀛?（えい）。
sen.e: His common name was Ryohei, his name Rui or Ei.
While he was known as Ryohei ODA, his actual name was Rui ODA or Ei ODA.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: While he was known as Ryohei ODA, his actual name was Rui ODA or Ei ODA.

sen.j: 字を巨海、号は海僊の他に百合（ひゃくこく）、百穀（ひゃくこく）。
sen.e: His azana was Kyokai and his pen name Hyakuko and Hyakuko in addition to Kaisen.
His nickname was Kyokai, and in addition to Kaisen, he was given the name Hyakukoku as his go (byname), which can be written as either '百合' or '百穀' in Japanese.
sen.cmt: 百合、百穀のローマ字表記の誤記を訂正しました。「百合」「百穀」は共に"ひゃくこく"と読むので、用語集を参照し、漢字表記の違いを説明しました。
sen.e: His nickname was Kyokai, and in addition to Kaisen, he was given the name Hyakukoku as his go (byname), which can be written as either '百合' or '百穀' in Japanese.

sen.j: 周防国富海（現 山口県防府市富海）に生まれ、長門国赤間関（現 山口県下関市）の紺屋（染工）を営む小田家の養子となる。
sen.e: He was born in Tonomi, Suo Province (present Tonomi, Hofu City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) and became an adopted child of the Oda family which ran a Koya dye shop in Akamagaseki, Nagato Province (present Shimonoseki City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).

He was born in the Tonomi district, Suo Province (present-day Tonomi, Hofu City, Yamaguchi Prefecture), and was adopted by the Oda family which ran a Koya dye shop in Akamagaseki, Nagato Province (present-day Shimonoseki City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 現→present-day（用語集等に合わせました。）～の養子となる→be adopted by ～（簡潔にしました。）
sen.e: He was born in the Tonomi district, Suo Province (present-day Tonomi, Hofu City, Yamaguchi Prefecture), and was adopted by the Oda family which ran a Koya dye shop in Akamagaseki, Nagato Province (present-day Shimonoseki City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).

sen.j: 22歳のとき、京都四条派の松村呉春に入門し、同門の松村景文や岡本豊彦らと名声を競ったが、やがて頼山陽に感化され南画に転向。
sen.e: At the age of 22, he became a disciple of Goshun MATSUMURA of Kyoto Shijo-ha school and competed in fame with Kebun MATSUMURA, Toyohiko OKAMOTO and others, but switched over to Nanga under the influence of Sanyo RAI.

Although he became a disciple of Goshun MATSUMURA of Kyoto Shijo-ha school at the age of 22, and competed with Keibun MATSUMURA, Toyohiko OKAMOTO and others in obtaining fame, Kaisen influenced by Sanyo RAI eventually changed his specialty to nanga.
sen.cmt: 松村景文→Keibun MATSUMURA（http://www.shibunkaku.co.jp/biography/search_biography_aiu.php?key=ma&s=200等より、訂正しました。）（競った）が、→Although（althoughで始まる文章に変更しました。）名声を競う→compete in obtaining fame（「名声を得るのを競う」ことなので、変更しました。）
sen.e: Although he became a disciple of Goshun MATSUMURA of Kyoto Shijo-ha school at the age of 22, and competed with Keibun MATSUMURA, Toyohiko OKAMOTO and others in obtaining fame, Kaisen influenced by Sanyo RAI eventually changed his specialty to nanga.

sen.j: 九州に遊学し、中国元 (王朝)明時代の書画の模写をするなどして研究を重ねて、独自の画風を確立した。
sen.e: He studied in Kyushu, where he went on with his research including reproduction of the calligraphic works and paintings of the Yuan (Dynasty) and the Ming period of China and established his own painting style.
While visiting Kyushu to study, he made researches by reproducing calligraphic works and paintings in the periods of Yuan Dynasty and Ming Dynasty of China, and established his own painting style.
sen.cmt: 全体的に分かりにくい英訳でしたので、変更しました。
sen.e: While visiting Kyushu to study, he made researches by reproducing calligraphic works and paintings in the periods of Yuan Dynasty and Ming Dynasty of China, and established his own painting style.

sen.j: 文政7年(1824年)、萩藩の御用絵師となり、一時江戸に滞在。
sen.e: In 1824, he became a Goyo-eshi (a purveying painter to the government) of Hagi Domain and stayed in Edo for a certain period of time.
In 1824, he became an official painter of Hagi Domain and stayed in Edo for a while.
sen.cmt: 御用絵師→official painter一時→for a while
sen.e: In 1824, he became an official painter of Hagi Domain and stayed in Edo for a while.
Two years later, he came back to Kyoto and started his activities.
Two years later, he came back to Kyoto and devoted himself to painting.
sen.cmt: この場合、「活動」は「絵を描く」ことなので「絵を描くことにいそしんだ」として英訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Two years later, he came back to Kyoto and devoted himself to painting.

sen.j: 嘉永元年(1848年)から安政元年（1854年）にかけて画室を設けているが、このころ富岡鉄斎に絵を教えたと推定されている。
sen.e: He had a studio from 1848 to 1854, around which he is presumed to have given lessons in paintings to Tessai TOMIOKA.
Since he had own atelier during a period from 1848 to 1854, it has been concluded that he taught paintings to Tessai TOMIOKA around that time.
Since he had own atelier during a period from 1848 to 1854, it has been concluded that he taught paintings to Tessai TOMIOKA around that time.

sen.j: 清楚な画風に特徴が有り、山水画、花鳥画、人物画を得意とした。
sen.e: He was characterized by his neat style and good at Sansui-ga (Chinese-style landscape painting), Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) and Portrait.
His painting style was characterized by its neatness, and he was good at Sansui-ga (Chinese-style landscape painting), Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) and portrait.
sen.cmt: 「彼の画風が清楚であるとの特徴が有る」なので、"characterized by"の主語を"he"から"his painting style"に変更しました。
sen.e: His painting style was characterized by its neatness, and he was good at Sansui-ga (Chinese-style landscape painting), Kacho-ga (painting of flowers and birds) and portrait.

sen.j: 高野山や京都御所の障壁画（1855年）などの大事業を手掛けている。
sen.e: He took on large projects of paintings on the walls or Fusuma including those of Mt. Koya and Kyoto Imperial Palace (1855).
He handled big projects of wall paintings at Mt. Koya and Kyoto Imperial Palace (1855).
He handled big projects of wall paintings at Mt. Koya and Kyoto Imperial Palace (1855).
He died in 1862 at the age of 78.
In 1862, he died at the age of 78.
sen.cmt: 語順を入れ替えました。
sen.e: In 1862, he died at the age of 78.

sen.j: 大徳寺黄梅院 (京都市)に眠る。
sen.e: He sleeps at Obai-in of Daitoku-ji Temple (Kyoto).
He was enshrined in Obai-in of Daitoku-ji Temple (Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 「眠る」は「安置されている」の意味であり、また、現在形では、「現在生きて寝ている」の意味となるため、変更しました。
sen.e: He was enshrined in Obai-in of Daitoku-ji Temple (Kyoto).
